11.content: This story from now on is a what if and not what actually occurred in the Stargate series so follow along and ad whenever you want.
11.title: Season one

12.content: This story from now on is a what if and not what actually occurred in the Stargate series so follow along and ad whenever you want.
12.title: Season two

choices: Carson wakes up a short while later...
121.content:
The Stargate swirled blue and took on a water-like appearance, shortly before five people walked through- John Sheppard, Teyla, Ronan, Dr. Rodney McKay, and Dr. Carson Beckett.

John took a quick glance around. The trees were thick around them, but he could make out the lights of a nearby village. "All right," He adressed the team, "Let's get over there before the sun sets."

The team made good time traveling through the forest, and soon they reached the moderately large village. A young girl stood at the entrance. She wore slightly tattered clothing and cloth boots that were much to big for her. Her eyes widened as she spotted them.

"I am Elieen. Are you the people Weir spoke of?"

Sheppard nodded, and the girl clapped to herself.

"Great! Here," A boy, no older than thirteen and who looked as he could be Elieen's older brother, slowly walked up to them and stood next to her. "This is Raye. He can take Beckett to Cristi. Erm... Which of you is Beckett?"

Carson gave a slight wave and smiled. "Here." He said with a thick Scottish accent.

"Okay. Raye will take you to Cristi. She's sick." A faraway gleam entered her eyes. "I just hope you can make her better."
After a second, she continued. "I can take the rest of you to the Tavern, you look tired from your long trek through the woods. Come!" And Elieen hurried away. Raye took Carson's hand and was pulling him onto one of the smaller cobblestone streets.

"I'll see you then," Carson said, before turning a corner and dissapearing from sight.

Raye let go of Carson Dr. Beckett. "We're almost there. Cristi's house is just up here." They came to a stop at a slightly small house. It wasn't particularly fancy, but it was friendly-looking, with flowerboxes in the windows. Raye opened the door.

Beckett stepped through. In the middle of the room, a teenage girl lay in a bed. She appeared to be asleep, but she was sweating and her face was very pale.

Carson dropped his medical supplies bag beside him and checked her pulse. It was irregular. As he opened his bag, Carson heard a noise behind him, but he firgured it was Raye following him in.
Then a sharp pain exploded near the base of his skull and Carson fell unconcious.
121.title: The Village
